name: contritely
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that shows you feel very sorry and guilty for something bad that you have done: "I'm sorry," Mark said contritely. He contritely admitted his guilt. See
contrite
More examplesFewer examples"I'm afraid I was a little bit bossy in those days," she admitted contritely. She smiled sweetly at Sean, then said contritely, "I'm so very sorry for anything I've said that has annoyed you".It is easy, sitting next to him as he speaks softly and contritely, to forget how feared he was.
